divs: sighting detailsvery bright blue white (like hid headlight intensity, or welder's arc color and intensity) elongated cone\teardrop with round end facing direction of travel and cone tapper toward rear, or shorter perfect sharp edged tail trailing. round head also had a slight copper\gold aura around white\blue color. moving very very slow 5-10 degrees w. of north at an altitude higher than nearby almost parrallel airliner contrail, to which it gradually passed behind, and very thin whispy cirrus cloud whisps. size\length from my location was comparable to width of two full moons in length, but only 1\4 a full moon in width at round head or widest part, as it tappered to a perfect point. most noticible fator or feature is the sharp distinct edges and perfect straight lines. no vapor trail!! if not for sharp edges, could have been daytime slow, slow meteor. but going way too slow!!! limited viewing time because of rising patchy fog and cumulus clouds. almost overcast but large breaks between clouds. started heading n on i-95 to go to atlanta georgia. left miami at 6:15 am on 9\4\2009. alot of early morning fog from west palm bch north, but started raising and transforming into low hung cumulus clouds from 9-9:30 am, as we passed through martin\st lucie counties. as we entered brevard county at about 10 am. at about 10:15-10:25 am i looked out the drivers window as i was driving and looked up as we had a big break in the semi-fog to low cumulus clouds at about due west of my position 65-75 degrees above the western horizon, to view a very bright blue sky, laced with one large airliner contrail, and whispy cirrus cloud whisps between two large cumulus cloud heads. to view the elongated cone with very sharp edges travelling very, very slow. the airliner contrail was running due north and south parralell to i-95 and must have been there for more than 5 minutes as it was in the phase of expanding and the plane was no where near. object was almost parrallel but to a 3-4 degree w. of north path, east of airliner contrail, which gradually took it behind the contrail before i lost sight of it due to clouds and to my direction and speed at 70 mph on 95 and maybe some blowing of cloud motion. no effect on me or my passengers or vehicle! passengers\my children were asleep in rear, my wife sitting on passenger side could not view it! i told her but she couldnt get an angle from the windshield to view. didnt get anymore breaks in clouds for about 5-8 minutes at 70 mph. next break couldnt see it anymore. didnt leave any vapor trails at all. fist assumtion, maybe a launch from cape kennedy as we were very close but still slightly south of nasa. object was moving north and west toward the cape????
Summary: Elongated Cone with round base appearing to be perfect edges with Gold/copper aura
trends: there have been no other sightings in cocoa bch\titusville
This sighting has never been favorited.
